title: Planet Profile Template
description: Defines the global-scale properties of the world's planet: its star, rotation, moons, tides, seasons, climate zones, prevailing winds, and constellations. These planetary-level decisions cascade down to affect every continent, settlement, and story.

star_type.description: Type of star (e.g., 'yellow dwarf' like our Sun, 'red dwarf', etc.)

rotation_direction.description: Direction of planet rotation (counterclockwise = Earth-like, sunrise in east)

axial_tilt.description: Axial tilt in degrees (Earth is 23.5; this affects seasons)

hours_per_day.description: Number of hours in one day (recommended: close to 24)

moon_count.description: Number of moons orbiting the planet

orbital_period_days.description: How many days for one orbit

tidally_locked.description: Whether this moon always shows the same face

moonlight_intensity.description: How bright the moonlight is (depends on surface reflectivity)

cultural_significance.description: What the inhabitants associate with this moon

conjunction_cycle.description: If multiple moons, how often they align. Formula: (P1 * P2) / (P2 - P1) = C days

equator_position.description: Description of where the equator falls relative to major landmasses

tropical.description: Wind direction in the tropics (Earth: easterly trade winds)

temperate.description: Wind direction in temperate zones (Earth: westerlies)

polar.description: Wind direction in polar zones (Earth: easterly)

prevailing_winds.description: Prevailing wind directions by latitude zone

ocean_current_direction.description: General ocean current patterns (e.g., 'clockwise in northern hemisphere, counterclockwise in southern')

other_planets.description: Other planets in the solar system visible to inhabitants

hemisphere_visibility.description: Which hemisphere(s) can see this constellation

seasonal_visibility.description: When this constellation is most visible

associated_deity.description: God or figure associated with this constellation

type.description: Whether formed by stars (light) or interstellar gas (dark)

cultural_meaning.description: What inhabitants believe about this constellation

constellations.description: Named constellations in the night sky

notable_comets_asteroids.description: Named comets or asteroids with cultural significance

tidal_notes.description: How tides work on this planet (spring tides, neap tides, multi-moon effects)

x-cross-references.climate-zone-reference: Climate zones are determined by this planet's properties
x-cross-references.continent-profile: Continents exist on this planet and are affected by its properties
x-cross-references.god-profile: Constellations may be associated with gods
x-cross-references.pantheon-overview: The pantheon may have influenced planetary creation
